alert.note: Alert for Garfield (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 03 at 6:18PM MDT until July 03 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Montana, including the following counties, Garfield and Southwest McCone. * WHEN...Until 1215 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 616 PM MDT, trained weather spotters reported heavy rain in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. This is causing small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Jordan, Cohagen, Hell Creek Rec Area, Flowing Wells Rest Area, Nelson Creek Rec Area, Brusett, Rock Creek Rec Area, Van Norman, Haxby and Steve Fork. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
